did.abstract: One 1883 letter from Adelaide Mudgley to Mr. L.E. Nicot, resigning from her position as a teacher at Brooklyn's Public School No. 19 in order to get married.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Adelaide Mudgley was a first grade teacher for girls at Public School No. 19 in Brooklyn. At the time of her resignation in 1883, she resided at 256 South Fourth Street.
Dr. Louis E. Nicot was the chairman of the local committee for school No. 19. He was active in local politics and civic affairs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft letter from Adelaide Mudgley to Mr. L.E. Nicot, resigning from her position as a teacher at Brooklyn's Public School No. 19 in order to get married. Dated August 27, 1883.
